projectContext: ViziAI - Blood test tracking app. Currently uses Google Sheets as backend. Migrating to Supabase for real database, auth, and multi-user support.

userStories.title: Create Supabase project config
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/supabase_config.py with SUPABASE_URL and SUPABASE_KEY placeholders
Add supabase-py to requirements.txt
Create .env.example with SUPABASE_URL and SUPABASE_KEY
Update .gitignore to exclude .env
Add instructions in README for setting up Supabase credentials
userStories.notes: User will manually create Supabase project and fill in credentials

userStories.title: Design and create Supabase database schema
acceptanceCriteria: Create supabase/migrations/001_initial_schema.sql
Tables: users (id, email, created_at), reports (id, user_id, file_name, sample_date, created_at), metrics (id, report_id, name, value, unit, ref_low, ref_high)
Add foreign key constraints
Add indexes on user_id and sample_date
Document schema in README or schema.md
userStories.notes: Schema should support multiple users with multiple reports, each report has multiple metrics

userStories.title: Create Supabase client wrapper
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/supabase_client.py
Function get_supabase_client() returns authenticated Supabase client
Loads credentials from environment variables
Handles missing credentials gracefully with clear error message
typecheck passes (if using type hints)

userStories.title: Create migration script for existing Google Sheets data
acceptanceCriteria: Create scripts/migrate_sheets_to_supabase.py
Reads all data from current Google Sheet (SHEET_NAME)
Creates a default user for existing data (owner's email or placeholder)
Parses the wide format (metrics as rows, dates as columns)
Inserts reports and metrics into Supabase
Prints summary: X reports migrated, Y metrics total
Script is idempotent (can run multiple times safely)
userStories.notes: This migrates father's existing blood test data

userStories.title: Update Python backend to write to Supabase
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/supabase_updater.py with same interface as sheets_updater
Function save_report(user_id, sample_date, tests_dict) inserts to Supabase
Function get_user_metrics(user_id) returns all metrics for dashboard
Update main.py to use supabase_updater instead of sheets_updater
Add --use-supabase flag to main.py (default: still use sheets for safety)
Test with one PDF extraction and verify data in Supabase
userStories.notes: Keep sheets_updater working for now as fallback

userStories.title: Create Next.js API route to fetch metrics from Supabase
acceptanceCriteria: Create web/src/app/api/metrics/route.ts
GET endpoint returns all metrics for a user (hardcode user_id for now)
Response format matches current Google Sheets API response
Add NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL and SUPABASE_SERVICE_KEY to web/.env.example
Install @supabase/supabase-js in web/
userStories.notes: Dashboard will call this instead of Google Sheets

userStories.title: Update dashboard to use Supabase API
acceptanceCriteria: Update web/src/app/dashboard/page.tsx to fetch from /api/metrics
Verify charts render correctly with Supabase data
Add loading state while fetching
Add error state if fetch fails
Test on localhost:3000/dashboard
userStories.notes: This completes the Supabase migration for read path

userStories.title: Set up Supabase Auth configuration
acceptanceCriteria: Document how to enable Google OAuth in Supabase dashboard
Create web/src/lib/supabase.ts with createClientComponentClient
Create web/src/lib/supabase-server.ts for server-side auth
Add auth-related env vars to web/.env.example
Update README with auth setup instructions
userStories.notes: Supabase Auth setup - Google OAuth preferred for simplicity

userStories.title: Create login page with Google OAuth
acceptanceCriteria: Create web/src/app/login/page.tsx
Add 'Sign in with Google' button
On success, redirect to /dashboard
On error, show error message
Style consistent with existing UI (Tailwind, dark theme)
Test login flow end-to-end

userStories.title: Protect dashboard route with auth
acceptanceCriteria: Create web/src/middleware.ts for auth protection
Redirect unauthenticated users from /dashboard to /login
After login, redirect back to /dashboard
Update /api/metrics to require authentication
Return 401 if not authenticated

userStories.title: Associate existing data with authenticated user
acceptanceCriteria: When user first logs in, check if they have data
If migrated data exists (from US-004), associate with user's Supabase user_id
Update migration script to use a placeholder user_id that can be claimed
Add 'claim data' flow or auto-claim on first login for owner
Document the data claiming process
userStories.notes: This connects the pre-migrated data to the real user account
